Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NUGET.SERVER - server packages from local" (#7957) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I have set up a local server with nuget.server. I can push packages to the repos. When I try to do install like so: 
nuget install <package>
Unable to load the service index for source '<mylocalrepos>' 
The content at '<mylocalrepos>' is not a valid JSON object
Am i missing something here? The source is defined in Nuget.Config as http://myserver/nuget

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Package Renames] Unblock deployments to existing search instances" (#7977) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We will be running two search instances side-by-side:

* `011` - The existing search service used to serve production traffic, without popularity transfers
* `012` - The new search service used to A/B test popularity transfers

We should be able to deploy the latest bits to both of these instances:

* [ ] Add a configuration to disable popularity transfers on a specific search instance
* [ ] Add the popularity transfers auxiliary file to all existing search deployments
  * [ ] DEV
  * [ ] INT
  * [ ] PROD
* [ ] Validate all jobs and services work on the existing `011` instance
  * [ ] `auxiliary2azuresearch`
  * [ ] `catalog2azuresearch`
  * [ ] Search service

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Embedded licenses files in MD are not encoded as HTML for display." (#7975) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### For issues connecting to NuGet.org, please refer to [this guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/faqs/nuget-faq#nugetorg-not-accessible).

### For issues regarding your NuGet.org account, please refer to [this guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/faqs/nuget-faq#nugetorg-account-management).

### Describe the bug
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

According to the specification embedded license files are accepted in either TXT or MD format.
https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Packaging-License-within-the-nupkg#license

However, MD files are not converted to HTML for display on the site and are rendered as raw Markdown.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. On this URL 'https://www.nuget.org/packages/SixLabors.ImageSharp/1.0.0-rc0001/License'

### Expected behavior
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

I would expect the markdown to be encoded as HTML.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to access account with unverified email" (#7968) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

The account https://www.nuget.org/profiles/wallymathieu is linked to my email, but I'm unable to access it due to the email not being verified, the password being lost.

### To Reproduce

Create an account. Have the delivery of the email fail (for instance due to some system filtering emails in between or a failure to send out the email)...

Try to restore the password using your email you get "Unverified email"

### Expected behavior

Either:

1) An account with no activity and unverified email (and no nuget packages) should perhaps be deleted?
2) An account with an unverified email should be able to use password reset.

### Additional context

The above mentioned nuget account is quite old. I got reminded of it https://github.com/fsprojects/FSharp.Formatting/pull/510#issuecomment-613568562 recently.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package statistics not updating properly" (#7928) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is an issue which has been going on for a while, but every time it's fixed it seems like it occurs again but slightly differently üòä

In the past the download stats has been frozen and when navigating to "View full stats" you could see that the date of the last update was old. **Now** the stats are not updating but the full stats page says the stats have been updated. For example it's been a while since the download stats increased for our main package:

https://www.nuget.org/packages/Piranha

However, `nuget.org` claims it was updated yesterday.

Given that we have several years of user statistics showing that this never happens it's highly unlikely that there would be **zero** downloads for a longer period. Also when this has occurred in the past, all of a sudden several hundred downloads are all of a sudden added on the statistics, so it gives the impression that the stats are recorded, but not propagated properly on package level for the site to show.

Best regards

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make 'dotnet list package' machine-readable" (#9524) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The output of `dotnet list package` today looks like:
```
Project 'foo.csproj' has the following package references
   [netstandard2.0]:
   Top-level Package                                Requested         Resolved
   > SomePackage                                    [1.1.6]           1.1.6
```

It would be useful if there was a machine-readable output format. This is useful for various scenarios such as gathering OSS license information based on packages used.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "`nuget.exe client-certs list` output is misaligned with `nuget.exe sources list` output" (#9530) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe

NuGet version: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3273

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

0. Create two Personal, Current certificates. 
1. Export the certificate with `certmgr.msc` in PFX format. In this example, we have `tw.pfx` and `so.pfx`
2. Use `nuget.exe client-certs add` to add the certificate to two sources. In this example, we have 
`aaaaaaaaa` and `bbbbbbbbb`
1. Run `nuget.exe client-certs list`
2. Run `nuget.exe sources list`
### Verbose Logs

```powershell
PS C:\repos\NuGet.Client> .\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.exe  client-certs
Registered client certificates:

 1.   bbbbbbbbb [fileCert]
      File path: .\tw.pfx
      Password: ****
      Certificates status: A fileCert path specified a file that does not exist.

 2.   aaaaaaaaa [fileCert]
      File path: .\tw.pfx
      Password: ****
      Certificates status: A fileCert path specified a file that does not exist.

PS C:\repos\NuGet.Client> .\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.exe sources list
Registered Sources:
  1.  NuGet.org [Enabled]
      https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
  2.  NuGetVolatile [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/nuget-volatile/api/v3/index.json
  3.  dotnet-core [Enabled]
      https://dotnetfeed.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet-core/index.json
  4.  dotnet-buildtools [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/dotnet-buildtools/api/v3/index.json
  5.  dotnet-roslyn [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/roslyn/api/v3/index.json
  6.  vside [Enabled]
      https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/azure-public/vside/_packaging/vs-impl/nuget/v3/index.json
  7.  dotnet-msbuild [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/msbuild/api/v3/index.json
  8.  vssdk [Enabled]
      https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/azure-public/vside/_packaging/vssdk/nuget/v3/index.json
```

### Sample Project

Run directy on NuGet.Client repo.

## Actual output

Numbers in `nuget.exe client-certs list` command have 1 less space on the left, 1 more on the right, compared to `nuget.exe sources list`

## Expected output

Numbers in both command have the same number of space characters before and after each number.

```powershell
PS C:\repos\NuGet.Client> .\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.exe  client-certs
Registered client certificates:

  1.  bbbbbbbbb [fileCert]
      File path: .\tw.pfx
      Password: ****
      Certificates status: A fileCert path specified a file that does not exist.

  2.  aaaaaaaaa [fileCert]
      File path: .\tw.pfx
      Password: ****
      Certificates status: A fileCert path specified a file that does not exist.

PS C:\repos\NuGet.Client> .\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.exe sources list
Registered Sources:
  1.  NuGet.org [Enabled]
      https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
  2.  NuGetVolatile [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/nuget-volatile/api/v3/index.json
  3.  dotnet-core [Enabled]
      https://dotnetfeed.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet-core/index.json
  4.  dotnet-buildtools [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/dotnet-buildtools/api/v3/index.json
  5.  dotnet-roslyn [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/roslyn/api/v3/index.json
  6.  vside [Enabled]
      https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/azure-public/vside/_packaging/vs-impl/nuget/v3/index.json
  7.  dotnet-msbuild [Enabled]
      https://dotnet.myget.org/F/msbuild/api/v3/index.json
  8.  vssdk [Enabled]
      https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/azure-public/vside/_packaging/vssdk/nuget/v3/index.json
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".NET Versioning Scheme" (#9426) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This is a tracking issue for any work and discussions necessary in order to support a solid versioning scheme for .NET starting with .NET 5.

There's a few ways this could go, so further tasks will be created under this epic as things are hashed out further.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Talk with .NET team to suss out versioning solution" (#9427) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: See ".NET versioning proposal" email. Need to get in touch with the team and figure out which solution we're going to go with.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "'dotnet list package'" (#9524) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Linux Test Failures in package signing code when executed on .NET 5 master" (#9523) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Package signing branch has few new entries defined in [build/config.props](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev-feature-xplatVerification/build/config.props#L40-L49) to define `dotnet` cli version for building and running tests. Updated `CliVersionForBuilding` .NET SDK version to .NET 5 latest stable preview release and `CliVersionForTesting` to `master` to test using latest release.

[Link to CI Build](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3692054&view=results) for the [PR](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3372)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove workaround of locking SDK version for building" (#9029) at NuGet/Home

When we are ready to ship, we should use the SDK installed on CI machines instead of a specified one.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org ‚Äì Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
